name: Elemental Enigma
description:
Final year game developed by Nathan Hessey, Charlotte Spurgeon, and Connor Munro, Elemental Enigma is a 3D puzzle game where players take on the role of a prisoner of a dark wizard. Players try to escape the wizard's tower through a series of levels presenting players with multiple puzzles and challenges requiring unique solutions. 

Players will need to complete the puzzles in order to get to the other side of the room to get to the next level. Within the level, players will be able to collect the Wizards Journal Pages which explain the lore of that specific power. Players will get shown whereabouts the journal pages are by a basic pan to its location after gaining the elemental power.  

Players will be able to open the journal to look at the pages whenever they like as it will be an icon in the bottom corner of the screen. This is a form of progression that shows the player that there are multiple pages to collect throughout the game.

The overall objective of the game is to defeat the dark, evil Wizard that captured you, and to escape the tower.
